speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: SCENE IV. The same. A street.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Enter GRATIANO, LORENZO, SALARINO, and SALANIO

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Nay, we will slink away in supper-time,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Disguise us at my lodging and return,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: All in an hour.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: We have not made good preparation.

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: We have not spoke us yet of torchbearers.

speaker: SALANIO
text_entry: 'Tis vile, unless it may be quaintly order'd,

speaker: SALANIO
text_entry: And better in my mind not undertook.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: 'Tis now but four o'clock: we have two hours

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: To furnish us.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Enter LAUNCELOT, with a letter

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Friend Launcelot, what's the news?

speaker: LAUNCELOT
text_entry: An it shall please you to break up

speaker: LAUNCELOT
text_entry: this, it shall seem to signify.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: I know the hand: in faith, 'tis a fair hand;

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: And whiter than the paper it writ on

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Is the fair hand that writ.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Love-news, in faith.

speaker: LAUNCELOT
text_entry: By your leave, sir.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Whither goest thou?

speaker: LAUNCELOT
text_entry: Marry, sir, to bid my old master the

speaker: LAUNCELOT
text_entry: Jew to sup to-night with my new master the Christian.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Hold here, take this: tell gentle Jessica

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: I will not fail her; speak it privately.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Go, gentlemen,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Exit Launcelot

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Will you prepare you for this masque tonight?

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: I am provided of a torch-bearer.

speaker: SALANIO
text_entry: Ay, marry, I'll be gone about it straight.

speaker: SALANIO
text_entry: And so will I.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Meet me and Gratiano

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: At Gratiano's lodging some hour hence.

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: 'Tis good we do so.

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: Exeunt SALARINO and SALANIO

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Was not that letter from fair Jessica?

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: I must needs tell thee all. She hath directed

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: How I shall take her from her father's house,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: What gold and jewels she is furnish'd with,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: What page's suit she hath in readiness.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: If e'er the Jew her father come to heaven,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: It will be for his gentle daughter's sake:

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: And never dare misfortune cross her foot,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Unless she do it under this excuse,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: That she is issue to a faithless Jew.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Come, go with me; peruse this as thou goest:

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Fair Jessica shall be my torch-beare r.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Exeunt
